articles.author: Jeff Mason, Steve Holland, Nandita Bose, Nathan Layne
articles.description: President Joe Biden was "soul searching" about dropping his Democratic reelection campaign, a source said, while Donald Trump prepared to accept the Republican presidential nomination in what aides said would be an unusually reflective speech.
articles.title: Biden weighs presidential race exit as Trump prepares for big moment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Telecommunications were widely disrupted in Bangladesh on Friday amid violent student protests against quotas for government jobs in which nearly two dozen people have been killed this week.
articles.title: Communications widely disrupted in Bangladesh as student protests spike

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces bombarded the Gaza Strip's historic refugee camps in the centre of the enclave and struck Gaza City in the north on Thursday, killing at least 13 people, and tanks pushed deeper into Rafah in the south, health officials and residents said.
articles.title: Israel bombards central Gaza as tanks advance deeper in Rafah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said it was investigating an apparent drone attack that hit central Tel Aviv in the early hours of Friday but which did not trigger the air raid sirens.
articles.title: Israeli military says Tel Aviv blast apparently caused by drone

articles.author: Gabriel Stargardter, Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: Tajik journalist Temur Varki received a disquieting call from Paris police in late March, days after Islamic State militants from his homeland allegedly carried out a massacre in Moscow.
articles.title: France races to head off ISIS-K threat to Paris Olympics

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado's security chief has been released from jail a day after he was arrested on charges of gender violence.
articles.title: Venezuelan opposition security chief released from jail

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Peru's judiciary said on Thursday it was extending the pre-trial detention of former President Pedro Castillo by 18 months while an investigation against him on charges of rebellion continues.
articles.title: Peru extends pre-trial detention for former president Castillo

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: New Zealand’s Foreign Minister Winston Peters said there needed to be "more diplomacy, more engagement, more compromise" to resolve the crisis in New Caledonia following sometimes violent protests that have been ongoing since May.
articles.title: New Zealand foreign minister calls for more diplomacy on New Caledonia

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Steve Holland, Nandita Bose
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden is taking calls to step aside as the Democratic presidential candidate seriously and multiple Democratic officials think an exit is a matter of time, according to sources familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Once defiant, Biden is now 'soul searching' about dropping out of race

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military is checking whether an explosion in central Tel Aviv in the early hours of Friday was caused by a drone attack, the army said.
articles.title: Israeli military checking possible drone attack after blast in Tel Aviv
